name.description: Belonie Scioneaux was born in 1931 in Vacherie, Louisiana, the son of Ernest and Martha Scioneaux. His family was employed by a plantation on which they lived, and he began working at a young age. As an adult he worked at Avondale Shipyard for a time before leaving because of health problems. He married at least twice (second wife: Audrey Kraemer Scioneaux), and had several children and stepchildren. Scioneaux, a native French speaker and resident of Chackbay, enjoyed hunting and helping at his daughter's restaurant, Nocko's Deli, until his death in 2011.

mods.abstract: Scioneaux discusses his childhood on a Louisiana plantation and his role in the workforce, as well as his job at the Avondale shipyard. He discusses his first wife and her infidelity, then tells an anecdote about his second wife and her eating habits. Scioneaux enjoys hunting and discusses his various guns, and shooting a rabbit. He explains his limited English, and offers some phrases in French.
